programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two (Subtitles) Rating: 9.2

programme.title: Marrying Mum and Dad
programme.desc: Down Under Season 5 Episode 7/10Best friends Tom and Alfie attempt to bring the Australian Outback to the West Midlands, complete with a bug-eating competition and an upside-down set (Subtitles) (Repeat) Rating: 8

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: The Dengineers: Christmas Den A nine-year-old who lives in one of the UK's most famous summer hotspots longs for a Christmas-themed den where she can celebrate her favourite season all year round (Subtitles) (Repeat) Rating: 7.6

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Blue Peter: Gold Badge Awards Junior Bake Off winner Reece makes a Mother's Day treat (Subtitles) (Repeat) Rating: 7.1

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Norway Season 4 Episode 4/11Steve Backshall heads to Norway to dive with the orca (Subtitles) (Repeat) Rating: 7.6

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: South Africa Season 4 Episode 5/11Steve Backshall witnesses a serval hunting in South Africa (Subtitles) (Repeat) Rating: 7.6

programme.title: Tinker Bell and the Pirate Fairy (2014)
programme.desc: A rebellious fairy steals the magic pixie dust that grants her people the power of flight and runs away, becoming captain of a band of pirates. Tinker Bell and her friends set off to recover the dust, but succumb to a spell that switches their magical powers. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Mae Whitman, Christina Hendricks and Tom Hiddleston (Subtitles)

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: South East Asia Season 1 Episode 10/10Monty Don brings his globe-trotting botanical tour to a close with a visit to South-east Asia, where he hopes to witness a true tropical oasis. Visiting the immaculately presented garden of Jim Thompson House in Bangkok, he discovers an exotic plot with a Western flavour. He also meets former president Lee Kuan Yew, who once stated that Singapore should be 'a city in a garden' (Subtitles) (Repeat) (Audio Described) Rating: 7.3

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc: Builders Season 1 Episode 3/6The presenter introduces animals that build structures and adapt the environment for their own benefit, creating safe places to sleep and raise young or traps to catch prey. The programme examines how the huge dams built by beavers can completely transform the surrounding landscape, the function of the different types of silk spiders are capable of producing, and how leafcutter ants build underground gardens where they farm their own food (Subtitles) (Repeat) (Audio Described) Rating: 7

programme.title: The Chronicles of Nadiya
programme.desc: Season 1 Episode 1/2Part one of two. Documentary following Great British Bake Off winner Nadiya Hussain as she takes a food-inspired journey and returns to her roots in Bangladesh. In the first edition, she travels to her family village near Sylhet in the north east of the country, where she shares her favourite recipes, including baked fish with green mango chutney and thoosha shinni. For a relative's wedding, she bakes a three-tiered pumpkin celebration cake for the bride, and she also takes the opportunity to reconnect with family she has not seen since her arranged marriage over ten years ago (Subtitles) (Repeat) (Audio Described) Rating: 5

programme.title: Beechgrove Repotted
programme.desc: Chris Beardshaw Garden Makeover Season 1 Episode 1/20Chris Beardshaw makes over Susan and Brian Duthie's new-build garden in Cove, Aberdeenshire, transforming their tiny site from the nightmare of rough builder's rubble (Subtitles) (Repeat) Rating: 6.4

programme.title: Your Garden Made Perfect
programme.desc: Season 1 Episode 6/6Mandy and Chris adore their Victorian home in Manchester, but they cannot unlock the potential of their garden. Overlooked on all sides, the couple feel exposed whenever they spend time in it. Providing inspiration for the area are designers Helen Elks-Smith and Pip Probert. Meanwhile, Joel Bird meets Ben and Elaine, a Wiltshire couple who have an unusual outdoor space. Angela Scanlon hosts (Subtitles) (Repeat) Rating: 1.8

programme.title: Up Periscope (1959)
programme.desc: A US Navy frogman is ordered to steal a vital Japanese code book from a Pacific island - but the captain of the submarine entrusted with taking him into enemy waters disapproves of the plan, causing tensions to rise and threatening the mission's success. Second World War adventure, with James Garner, Edmond O'Brien and Alan Hale Jr (Subtitles) Rating: 3.7

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Season 15 Episode 7/60People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction (Subtitles) (Repeat) Rating: 6.6

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets
programme.desc: Season 1 Episode 2/3Stacey Dooley helps people answer life-changing questions by examining their DNA. This time, Stacy meets 31-year-old Duri, who fears she may carry a potentially fatal genetic mutation and wants to test her DNA to see if she could suffer from the same disease as her mother. Elsewhere, a woman who was adopted when she was just six-months-old wants to use DNA technology to finally uncover information about her ancestry (Subtitles) (Repeat) (Audio Described) Rating: 4.6

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr Season 2 Episode 6/8As they fight to secure a place in the semi-finals, the four remaining designers are challenged to transform two hair salons in Richmond, London, and for the first time in the competition, the designers will see their spaces before creating their visions. Presenter Alan Carr and judge Michelle Ogundehin will then decide who makes it through to the next stage (Subtitles) (Repeat) (Audio Described) Rating: 1.8

programme.title: The 80s with Dominic Sandbrook
programme.desc: The Sound of the Crowd Season 1 Episode 1/3Historian Dominic Sandbrook follows up his 2012 documentary series The 70s by moving on to the following decade. He begins by examining how powerful new forces of choice and consumerism radically reshaped British life - a new culture of consumer-driven populism that propelled Margaret Thatcher to victory. He takes in everything from the popularity of Delia Smith and affordable fashions on the high street, to the subcultures of Britain's youth and the crisis of identity that rocked and splintered the political left (Subtitles) (Repeat) (Audio Described) Rating: 3.7

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Top of the Pops: The Story of 1980 Documentary exploring the music show's evolution, and the dramatic changes that took place in 1980 when a new generation of British pop arrived, leading to the veteran Top of the Pops orchestra being laid off, and the studio audience doubling in size. Featuring Adam Ant, the Human League, OMD, Kevin Rowland, Sally Lindsay, Kelly Marie, Ray Dorset, Johnny Logan, the Vapors, the Piranhas, and Richard Skinner (Subtitles) (Repeat) Rating: 7.5

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Rogue Season 18 Episode 14/16Bill Bailey, Jack Carroll and Olga Koch join regular Alan Davies as Sandi Toksvig hosts an extended edition of the quiz with a difference, asking questions on the theme of rogue (Subtitles) Rating: 6.5

programme.title: Billie: In Search of Billie Holiday (2020)
programme.desc: A profile of the American jazz singer, capturing her depths and complexity through interviews conducted by journalist Linda Lipnack Kuehl with those who knew her best. With contributions by Charles Mingus, Tony Bennett, Sylvia Syms and Count Basie, as well as her cousin, schoolfriends, lovers, lawyers, pimps and even the FBI agents who arrested her (Subtitles)

programme.title: Whiplash (2014)
programme.desc: A talented young jazz drummer thinks all his dreams have come true when he lands a place at a prestigious music academy. However, the experience turns into a nightmare thanks to an uncompromising tutor who will stop at nothing to make his students realise their potential - including physical and mental abuse. Drama, starring Miles Teller, JK Simmons and Paul Reiser (Subtitles) (Premiere) Rating: 7

programme.title: Jazz Divas Gold
programme.desc: A selection of archive performances by acclaimed female jazz artists from shows including Not So Much a Programme - More a Way of Life, Morecambe and Wise, Parkinson and Show of the Week. Featuring Ella Fitzgerald, Peggy Lee, Blossom Dearie, Nina Simone, Cleo Laine, Marion Montgomery, Betty Carter, Sarah Vaughan, Eartha Kitt and Amy Winehouse (Subtitles) (Repeat) Rating: 3

programme.title: Clouds of Sils Maria (2014)
programme.desc: A famous actress prepares to star in a new production of the play that made her career in a supporting part, with the lead role now played by a scandalous Hollywood star. She and her assistant head to a cottage in the Swiss mountains to prepare, which leads her to reflect on the harsh truths about how her life has changed. Drama, starring Juliette Binoche, Kristen Stewart and Chloe Grace Moretz (Subtitles) Rating: 8.5

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two (Subtitles) Rating: 9.2
